intro: Tetranthera flexuosa, commonly known as the climbing tetranthera, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is a perennial vine characterized by its slender, twisting stems and opposite, ovate leaves with serrated margins. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne in the axils of the leaves. Its fruits are small, dry capsules that release tiny seeds when mature. Tetranthera flexuosa is native to tropical regions of South America and is often found in humid, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth.
